model¶

Forms¶

class accounts.forms.AddFundsBankForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Class defining the form for adding funds to an account via a bank account. The form requires a routing number (a 9-digit value which identifies the bank), as well as a 10-digit account number. A positive dollar amount to add is also required

clean() → dict¶

Function responsible for validating the input of an AddFundsBankForm. Raises a ValidationError if any of the requirements for the form fields are not met

Returns

a dictionary containing the form’s valid input, self.cleaned_data

property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class accounts.forms.AddFundsCryptoForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Class defining the form for adding funds to an account via a crypto wallet. The form requires a wallet address between 25 and 36 characters, as well as a dollar amount to add

clean() → dict¶

Function responsible for validating the input of an AddFundsCryptoForm. Raises a ValidationError if any of the requirements for the form fields are not met

Returns

a dictionary containing the form’s valid input, self.cleaned_data

property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class accounts.forms.CustomPasswordResetForm(*args, **kwargs)¶
property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class accounts.forms.CustomUserCreationForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Class defining the form for creating a user account. Includes typical username and password options, as well as first and last name, email address, account type (public or private), birthday, skill level, and a bio field.

class Meta¶

Overwriting existing configuration inherited from the UserCreationForm

model¶

alias of accounts.models.CustomUser

property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

save(commit=True) → accounts.models.CustomUser¶

Saves all the form data for a new user into the database

Parameters

commit – boolean whether to commit the save

Returns

the saved user

class accounts.forms.RequestForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Form for submitting a friend request

property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class accounts.forms.WithdrawForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Class defining the form for withdrawing money from an account. The form requires a positive dollar amount to withdraw

clean()¶

Function responsible for validating the input of a WithdrawForm. Raises a ValidationError if any of the requirements for the form fields are not met

Returns

a dictionary containing the form’s valid input, self.cleaned_data

property media¶

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Models¶

class accounts.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)¶

Class representing the model for a user of the Online Casino. Associated with each user is a username, password, first and last name, email address, account type (public or private), birthday, skill level, bio, as well as the current account balance and total earnings over time

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
accept_friend_request(other_username: str) → bool¶

Accepts a friend request to the user with the given username

Parameters

other_username – username of the friend request to accept

Returns

true if the friend request is accepted, false otherwise

static check_username_exists(username: str) → bool¶

checks if the username exists

Parameters

username – username of the user that is being checked

Returns

true if the user exists, false if not

deposit(deposit_amount: float) → bool¶

Deposits a certain amount of money from a crypto or bank account into user’s account. Returns false if deposit exceeds monthly deposit limit. Returns true if deposit is successful. Will also check the next date for resetting monthly deposit limit and adjust it to one month in advance and refresh monthly deposit limit if current date exceeds next month’s reset date.

Parameters

deposit_amount – float amount of money to deposit into user’s account

Returns

boolean value indicating if transaction was successful

remove_friend(other_username: str) → bool¶

Removes a friend with the username provided

Parameters

other_username – username of the friend that should be removed

Returns

true if the friend is removed, false otherwise

send_friend_request(other_username: str) → bool¶

Sends a friend request to the user with the given username

Parameters

other_username – username to which the friend request is being sent

Returns

true if the friend request is sent, false otherwise

update_balance(update_amount: float) → bool¶

Updates a user’s current account balance, incrementing it by the specified value.

Parameters

update_amount – Value representing the amount by which to change the account balance. Use a negative number to decrement the value.

Returns

true if the update succeeded, false otherwise

withdraw(withdraw_amount: float) → bool¶

Withdraws the specified amount from user’s account into linked bank account

Parameters

withdraw_amount – float amount of money to withdraw from user’s account

Returns

boolean value indicating if transaction was successful

Views¶

class accounts.views.AccountView(**kwargs)¶

Class view for the Account game page. Simply displays the accounts.html page.

class accounts.views.AddFundsBankView(**kwargs)¶

Class view for the adding funds from bank account game page. Displays the html page and the form.

class accounts.views.CustomLoginView(**kwargs)¶

Class representing the view for the login page. Uses the CustomAuthenticationForm defined in forms.py, and redirects to the index page upon submission and processing of the form.

form_class¶

alias of accounts.forms.CustomAuthenticationForm

post(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Handle POST requests: instantiate a form instance with the passed POST variables and then check if it’s valid.

class accounts.views.SignUpView(**kwargs)¶

Class representing the view for the signup page. Uses the CustomUserCreationForm defined in forms.py, and redirects to the index page upon submission and processing of the form.

form_class¶

alias of accounts.forms.CustomUserCreationForm

form_valid(form: accounts.forms.CustomUserCreationForm) → django.http.response.HttpResponse¶

Validates the CustomUserCreationForm. Then creates a user with the specified information, logs them in, and redirects to the index page if the form is valid.

Parameters

form – the complete CustomUserCreationForm form to be validated

Returns

An HttpResponse redirecting to index

accounts.views.accept_friend_request(request: django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIRequest)¶

View function for the accept friend request page.

Parameters

request – WSGIRequest object containing the request information

Returns

For a POST request, returns an HttpResponse object redirecting back to the account page. Otherwise, returns an HttpResponse object rendering the withdraw.html page.

accounts.views.friends_view(request: django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIRequest)¶

View function for the friends page.

Parameters

request – WSGIRequest object containing the request information

Returns

For a POST request, returns an HttpResponse object redirecting back to the account page. Otherwise, returns an HttpResponse object rendering the withdraw.html page.

accounts.views.remove_friend(request: django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIRequest)¶

View function for the remove friend request page.

Parameters

request – WSGIRequest object containing the request information

Returns

For a POST request, returns an HttpResponse object redirecting back to the account page. Otherwise, returns an HttpResponse object rendering the withdraw.html page.

accounts.views.send_friend_request(request: django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIRequest) → django.http.response.HttpResponse¶

View function for the send friend request page.

Parameters

request – WSGIRequest object containing the request information

Returns

For a POST request, returns an HttpResponse object redirecting back to the account page. Otherwise, returns an HttpResponse object rendering the withdraw.html page.

accounts.views.withdraw_funds(request: django.core.handlers.wsgi.WSGIRequest) → django.http.response.HttpResponse¶

View function for the withdraw funds page. For a valid POST request, the appropriate funds will be removed from the account and the user will be redirected to the account page.

Parameters

request – WSGIRequest object containing the request information

Returns

For a POST request, returns an HttpResponse object redirecting back to the account page. Otherwise, returns an HttpResponse object rendering the withdraw.html page with a WithdrawForm.
